name: Fancourt

reviews.text: On our way back to Cape Town we booked two nights at Fancourt. When we checked in they informed us that the kids had to sleep upstairs but that it was easy for them to go to our room downstairs. The rooms have a front door which we locked from the inside before going to bed. Since we have young children we left the individual rooms to our suites open. At 2.30am we heard somebody coming into the front door and stepping in. We got an enourmous fright and jumped out of bed to investigate, luckily we could not find anybody inside and our kids were save upstairs. When coming back in the hallway somebody knocked at our door, he said he was from room service to collect the breakfast orders. I could hardly believe that somebody just walks into a room which we locked from the inside, especially at 2.30am. I phoned reception and they were very passive, they reacted like "oh is he doing it again at this time, we will inform security". Apparently the gentleman was indeed working for the hotel. When we tested the front door it appeared that, although we thought it was locked, you could open it from the outside. We barricaded the door and tried to get some sleep, which was difficult . In the morning we contacted reception again, they promised to fix the front door. When I called again a couple of hours later they told me the front door could not be fixed. I found that hard to believe because it has a lock. The only thing they could do is to instruct room service not to just come into our room. Not satisfied with the situation we barricaded the door again for the second night. All in all a very disappointing experience. The rooms are clean but have cheap finishings. Ttv and the appliances are all of inferior brands, Service was poor because they are not well informed and did not follow up on our issue. This hotel does not deserve 5 stars!
reviews.title: woken up by room service at 2.30am

reviews.text: This is a hotel for golfers with great walking trails. We stayed at an owner lodge and we were not treated with the same courtesy as if we were staying at the actual hotel. Maybe it's supposed to work that way. The Reception staff were not very helpful.... Maybe this is just not the place for us. They had lovely grounds, exercise room, pools, etc, etc. The units were wonderful, but some things did not work well and it was impossible to get help. Considering this is a 5 star establishment, I expected better. I might recommend the hotel, but with some reservations.
reviews.title: Great golf courses and walking trails

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights as part of an organised golf trip. We had standard rooms which were a little small but comfortable for a short stay. Three of the restaurants were closed as the hotel was quiet. On the first night we ate in La Cantina restaurant which was quite poor. The service wasn't great and the presentation and quality of the food was poor. On the second night we went into George and had an excellent meal for about half the price. We played the Outeniqua and Montagu courses which were excellent, as were all the golfing staff and Caddies. Well worth a 2 or 3 day visit to play the golf courses.
reviews.title: Good golf

reviews.text: This is one of the cases where you have to separate infrastructure from the human factor. While the grounds, rooms, and facilities are very nice and well kept, the service has been surprisingly poor, especially considering this is a LHW property.
reviews.title: Beware

reviews.text: Fancourt Hotel & Golf Estate was just the getaway we needed. There was something for everyone – golf, spa, children's activities, swimming pools, great food, friendly and attentive (but not intrusive) staff, even some local wildlife (monkeys, duck, birds, lizards) – the full package. The breakfast food was only surpassed by the brilliant view and dinner in the evening restaurant was great (as our waistlines can attest). We spent four days enjoying all the amenities on the estate and got plenty of exercise walking around the pedestrian paths surrounding the two golf courses. We scored a great package with lots of extras (even in the midst of so-called "World Cup Fever" season). Our 6 year old still talks about it and we're all looking forward to returning one day!
reviews.title: Perfect getaway

reviews.text: Stayed in one of the Resort Lodges for five days of serious golfing. The lodges themselves are very comfortable but lacking in super high whizz gadgetry ... not that you necessarily need/want that. Staff are all very friendly and breakfast is magnificent (as my waistline will confirm). As for the golf, well the Gary Player-designed Links is truly astonishing (and astonishingly tough when played in high winds), although the Montague, while beautifully manicured, is probably a little overrated (once considered South Africa's premier course). I preferred Oubaai, an Ernie Els track a 20-minute drive away. George is a staggeringly scenic part of the world, although there isn't a tonne to do in the town itself. Not exactly a hotbed of action you might say, although there are some pretty decent restaurants. "Unfortunately they closed the strip club," lamented one local chap I befriended in the hotel bar. (I should point out that "they" isn't Fancourt; the strip joint was in town somewhere). All in all a wonderful place to get away from it all (and play lots of golf). Oh, and if you get the chance, try a bottle of Retief Goosen's wine, "The Goose" Expression. Rather nice Shiraz/Cabernet Sauvignon blend.
reviews.title: Great Golf, Great Stay

reviews.text: The restaurants are all of a good quality, although the ones we use most are Zansibar (African menu) and La Cantina (Italian) both of which are well priced and with varied menus.
reviews.title: Golf Nirvana ...

reviews.text: Golf is very popular at Fancourt and there are three courses that the guests have access to. The Montague, The Outeniqua and The Links, the latter of which has played host to the President's Cup. The Links is as tough as any course you will ever play, especially off the back tees, but to stay at Fancourt and not to give it a go would be to miss out on one of golf's greatest courses.
reviews.title: Very cold and unhelpful welcome...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot comment on value for money as I went on conference and have no idea how much it cost. Although I do not play golf, walking around the estate you can see the course is kept in mint condition even though they are having the worst drought in that area in 133 years. It is one of the most beautiful settings I have ever seen anywhere in the world. It is approximately 15 kilometers from the sea and you can drive East or West along the coast and you will see some of the most beautiful countryside in the world. It is not called the Garden Route for nothing. It would be a great hotel in which to base yourself if you wanted to see the sites. My only disappointment was the food which I felt was not of 5 star standard
reviews.title: Great golf centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights. The room was spacious and comfortable. Staff were reasonably friendly. The golf courses are superb which was the main reason we visited. We enjoyed meals in both restaurants which were good quality and value.
reviews.title: Brilliant for golfers, rather boring for non golfers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative was being charged for everything. We expected internet and bottled water to be available as part of the service but both were charged for. In theis class of property at the rates paid, they should be included. They were at the other hotels on our trip.
reviews.title: A very disappointing experience!

description: Positioned on 613 hectares in the magnificent Garden Route, outside George, Fancourt is South Africa’s premier lifestyle estate with mountains, forests and the warm Indian Ocean in close proximity. 135 luxury rooms, fantastic family facilities, three Gary Player designed golf courses, a Spa, a Kids Club and various restaurants guarantee enjoyment.
